main event: Several reports of unidentified flying objects were documented in Meridian, Mississippi and surrounding areas on November 13 and 14, 1950.
interesting points: The objects were described as moving at high altitudes and speeds, with reports of one object observed at 55,000 feet for 25 minutes., There was speculation by the public about the nature of the sightings, with many suggesting they could be jets or blimps., Multiple witnesses, including pilots from the Mississippi Air National Guard, reported seeing the objects and losing them in haze or darkness., A streak of light was observed, changing color as it moved across the sky, confirmed by local media accounts., The sightings generated significant local and media attention, with various explanations proposed such as vapor trails or flying saucers.
sighted object: unidentified flying object (UFO), bright streak of light, and other aerial phenomena
witness description: witnesses included local citizens, pilot officers, and control tower operators
